text: Cream ale che mi sa molto di apa. Aroma fresco di frutta e agrumi, si confermano al palato, amarezza piena. Buona.

Draft sample at In De Wildeman during Carnival Brettanomyces 2016. Amsterdam, The Netherlands. 25.06.2016. Pour it yellow color with big white head. Aroma lemon, some malty feel, passion fruits, floral amazing. Taste easy drinkable, refreshing, sweet fruity feel, not brett feel, grassy feel at the end. Perfect balanced. Really nice!

(Cloudwater Bretted Cream Ale) Tap at In De Wildeman, day three of Carnivale Brettanomyces. 150 ml glass.
Orange coloured body, slightly hazy, with a tall and thick white head on top, very good retention.
Aroma of citrus, orange and tangerine and a hint of funkiness.
Taste follows, citrus, orange, some tropical fruits now, grass, tangerine, again only a touch of funky character at first, becomes stonger on the finish though.
Medium thin body, good carbonation, quite dry on the palate.
Pretty good.

Sampled from tap at In de Wildeman during Carnivale Brettanomyces 2016. Clear, golden yellow with a white head. Sweetish, fruity aroma of lemon, some passion fruit, some grains and hints of butter. Sweetish, slightly bitter, fruity taste of caramel, some honey, lemon, grains, some passion fruit and hints of butter, followed by a medium long, moderately bitter and a little grassy finish. Medium body, slightly creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Nice!

Tap @ In De Wildeman, Carnivale Brettanomyces 2016, courtesy of SImon, thanks! Pale yellow color. White head. Aromas: creamy, leafy and flowery hops. Retronasal: fruity sourness, creamy, flowery hops. Flavor is soft, moderate bitter. Light bodied. Finishes moderate bitter.
Draft at Churchkey. Hazy yellow color. Peppery and dusty haystack aroma. Taste is bitter peppery straw. Highly hopped.

17th March 2016Brewdog Shepherd Bush. Keg. Lightly hazy yellow - gold beer, good pale cream colour head. Palate is airy and has a good fine minerally crispness. Thin malts, a mild sweetness. Mellow yellow grapefruit bitterness, touch of orange. Modest savoury brett. Light dry bitterish seltzer finish. Never really takes off.

Keg at Bd SB, London. It pours a hazed pale yellow color with a small white head. Aroma is mostly crispy and dry with notes of straw, grass, Lebanon peel and earth. Taste has more earthy dry tones, light sweetness with more lemon peel and grains, yeast. Light bodied with good carbonation. Overall, ok

Keg at Brewdog Sheps Bush. Light hazed yellow coloured pour with a big frothy white head. Aroma is perfume Brett c, pineapple, hint of wheaty grains. Flavour so composed of wheaty grains, lemon, pineapple, hint of funk. Palate is muted, lowish carbonation. Grainy. Decent.

Keg at BDSB - London. Pours lightly hazy yellow with a creamy, white head. The nose has some lemon peel, minerals, dried hay. Light sweet flavorbwith a little woody dryness, more lemon peel, flinty minerals, grain husk. Light bodied with fine carbonation. Drying finish, woody, with more minerals, husky pale grains, rindy citrus. So so.
